Employment

TIULA ARCHITECTS, Architect
2014 - 2015

Served as a project architect developing permitting and construction documents for residential housing projects primarily in the US market.

BOONCON PIXELS OY, Designer/Web Developer
2012 - 2015

Employed as a brand advisor, UI/UX specialist, and front end web-developer. Business strategist for marketing, sales, and office management.

LAB ARCHITECTURE STUDIO, Graduate Architect
2010 - 2011

Specialized in parametric design for developed design phases of construction on commercial, public and urban master planning projects.

BRETT WEBBER ARCHITECTS, Student Intern
2007-2010

Responsible for construction and permitting documentation. Developed 3D models and renderings.

Skills

LANGUAGE

Native English, with proficiency in Spanish and Finnish.

SOFTWARE

Microsoft Office, Adobe InDesign, Illustrator, Photoshop, Sketch, Affinity Designer, Affinity Photo, Keynote, AutoCad, Revit, ArchiCAD, Rhino 3D, Grasshopper, Microstation, Sketchup, EcoTect, Vray, FinalCut Pro, Ableton Live 9, HTML5, CSS3, Javascript.

Awards

AIA Missing Middle Housing Competition
2015

In collaboration with Niko Tiula, we won 1st Prize for the international open invitational competition. Our entry explores new mixed-income housing typologies designed for walkable, sustainable communities along Michigan's urban corridors.

Katara Hills, Qatar, Architecture Invitational
2013

Nominated as an Aalto University representative to travel to Doha, Qatar for a luxury housing competition.

World Design Capital Helsinki, Highrise Design
2012

Awarded a centre city billboard installation featuring my work as a part of the World Design Capital Helsinki 2012 exhibition. The billboard displayed a highrise design born out of a collaborative studio between Aalto University Department of Architecture and UCLA Architecture and Urban Design.

Sannas Manner Architecture Competition
2012

1st Prize recipient for the open invitational competition hosted by Sännäs Manor. In collaboration with Leonard Ma, we presented a phased renovation plan that updates and beautifies existing buildings on the campus, and reconfigures pedestrian flows for better efficiency.
